segments.source_content: Itâ€™s not a code change, but itâ€™s an impactful terminology change that is now officially published on the React v19 docs site. Server Actions are now considered a subset of a broader Server Function feature. It only becomes an action when used within:

translations.fr: Ce n'est pas un changement de code, mais une modification terminologique importante dÃ©sormais officiellement publiÃ©e sur le site de documentation de React v19. Les Server Actions sont dÃ©sormais considÃ©rÃ©es comme un sous-ensemble de la fonctionnalitÃ© plus large des Server Functions. Elles ne deviennent une action que lorsqu'elles sont utilisÃ©es dans :
translations.en: Ce n'est pas un changement de code, mais un changement terminologique important dÃ©sormais officiellement publiÃ© sur la documentation React v19. Les Server Actions sont dÃ©sormais considÃ©rÃ©es comme un sous-ensemble de la fonctionnalitÃ© plus large des Server Functions. Elles ne deviennent des actions que lorsqu'elles sont utilisÃ©es dans :

segments.source_content: This change clarifies that â€œuse serverâ€ is about exposing a server endpoint, not necessarily limited to mutations. Fetching data and JSX with Server Functions might not be an anti-pattern after all.

translations.fr: Ce changement clarifie que "use server" concerne l'exposition d'un point de terminaison serveur, pas nÃ©cessairement limitÃ© aux mutations. RÃ©cupÃ©rer des donnÃ©es et du JSX avec des Server Functions pourrait finalement ne pas Ãªtre un anti-modÃ¨le.
translations.en: Ce changement clarifie que "use server" concerne l'exposition d'un endpoint serveur, pas nÃ©cessairement limitÃ© aux mutations. RÃ©cupÃ©rer des donnÃ©es et du JSX avec des Server Functions pourrait finalement ne pas Ãªtre un anti-pattern.

segments.source_content: **About Next.js Server Actions**: they use `POST` requests and run sequentially, but this is a Next.js implementation detail and React doesnâ€™t prevent you from running actions in parallel. The Next.js team has confirmed their intention to introduce new APIs to call Server Functions with `GET`.

translations.fr: **Ã€ propos des Server Actions de Next.js** : elles utilisent des requÃªtes `POST` et s'exÃ©cutent sÃ©quentiellement, mais il s'agit d'un dÃ©tail d'implÃ©mentation de Next.js et React ne vous empÃªche pas d'exÃ©cuter des actions en parallÃ¨le. L'Ã©quipe Next.js a confirmÃ© son intention d'introduire de nouvelles API pour appeler les Server Functions avec `GET`.
translations.en: **Ã€ propos des Server Actions de Next.js** : elles utilisent des requÃªtes `POST` et s'exÃ©cutent sÃ©quentiellement, mais c'est un dÃ©tail d'implÃ©mentation de Next.js. React ne vous empÃªche pas d'exÃ©cuter des actions en parallÃ¨le. L'Ã©quipe Next.js a confirmÃ© son intention d'introduire de nouvelles API pour appeler les Server Functions avec `GET`.

translations.en: **[React DevTools 6.0](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/main/packages/react-devtools/CHANGELOG.md#600)**

segments.source_content: The React DevTools have been the focus of a lot of work recently, notably the ability to present a unified easy-to-understand React tree for Server and Client components. The browser extensions have not been published, but the v6 changelog is available with many PRs and screenshots to look at. From what I see, the team has done an incredible work to provide a great DX around element inspection, profiling, logging, stacktraces, sourcemaps.

translations.fr: Les React DevTools ont rÃ©cemment fait l'objet de nombreux travaux, notamment la capacitÃ© Ã  prÃ©senter un arbre React unifiÃ© et facile Ã  comprendre pour les composants Serveur et Client. Les extensions de navigateur n'ont pas encore Ã©tÃ© publiÃ©es, mais le journal des modifications de la v6 est disponible avec de nombreuses PR et captures d'Ã©cran Ã  consulter. D'aprÃ¨s ce que je constate, l'Ã©quipe a accompli un travail remarquable pour offrir une excellente expÃ©rience dÃ©veloppeur (DX) autour de l'inspection d'Ã©lÃ©ments, du profilage, de la journalisation, des traces de pile et des sourcemaps.
translations.en: Les React DevTools ont rÃ©cemment fait l'objet de nombreux travaux, notamment la capacitÃ© Ã  prÃ©senter un arbre React unifiÃ© et facile Ã  comprendre pour les composants Serveur et Client. Les extensions de navigateur n'ont pas encore Ã©tÃ© publiÃ©es, mais le journal des modifications de la v6 est disponible avec de nombreuses PR et captures d'Ã©cran Ã  consulter. D'aprÃ¨s ce que je vois, l'Ã©quipe a accompli un travail remarquable pour offrir une excellente expÃ©rience dÃ©veloppeur (DX) autour de l'inspection d'Ã©lÃ©ments, du profilage, de la journalisation, des traces de pile et des sourcemaps.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [React Bricks - Transform React components into dynamic, visually editable bricks of content with the pioneering React Visual Headless CMS.](https://www.reactbricks.com/?utm_source=twir&utm_campaign=ql24)
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR \- Update Dynamic APIs to be async](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/68812): The PR we mentioned last week (turning APIs such as `cookies()`, `headers()` and `searchParams` async) has been merged and released in Next.js 15 canary 171\. Libraries might have to adjust their code accordingly ([nuqs](https://x.com/fortysevenfx/status/1839158893710033141)) or introduce breaking changes ([Clerk](https://x.com/tweetsbycolin/status/1839273740577759603)). Migration instructions will be provided very soon.
- ğŸ‘€ [Next.js PR \- Add `connection()` as a new dynamic API](https://github.com/vercel/next.js/pull/69949): A new API to bail out of pre-rendering will replace `unstable_noStore()`.
- ğŸ¦ [React Core \- Lazy Context Propagation has been enabled for React 19 and React Native](https://x.com/sebastienlorber/status/1841042683122286641): This shouldnâ€™t impact you directly, but it's an important implementation detail change that sets the stage for upcoming features to optimize React Context consumption.
- ğŸ¦ [React Router \- Typesafety improvements preview](https://x.com/pcattori/status/1841166684180402378): React Router will soon be able to generate types manually (CLI) or automatically (TS plugin) to improve type-safety.
- ğŸ—“ï¸ [React-Brussels](https://www.react.brussels/?utm_source=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡§ğŸ‡ª Brussels - 18 October - Last call! You still have a chance to get your ticket, and donâ€™t forget the [10% discount](https://ti.to/react-rally/react-rally-2024/discount/TWIR) with code "TWIR".
- ğŸ—“ï¸ [React Summit US](https://reactsummit.us/?utm_source=Newsletter&utm_medium=thisweekinreact) - ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ New-York - 19 & 22 December - 10% discount with code TWIR. Full line-up revealed!
- ğŸ“œ [Cloudflare Builder Day 2024 \- 18 big updates to the Workers platform](https://blog.cloudflare.com/builder-day-2024-announcements/): Cloudflare made relevant announcements for React devs. They improved Node.js compatibility and added support for Static Assets. They also joined the OpenNext initiative and published a new adapter to reduce Next.js vendor lock-in and to make it more portable outside Vercel without compromises.
- ğŸ“œ [Level up your env var tooling in Next.js with DMNO](https://dmno.dev/blog/dmno-nextjs-launch/): This interesting tool can help prevent leaking secrets in a modern React RSC world. It also supports Remix, Astro, and Vite.
- ğŸ“œ [The unspoken rules of React hooks](https://macwright.com/2024/09/19/the-extra-rules-of-hooks): Some functions returned by React (such as `setState`) are known to be stable and do not need to be added to dependency arrays. This rule is implicit and thereâ€™s no way for third-party libraries to declare their returned functions as stable.
- ğŸ“œ [SSR-friendly Custom React Hook for Local Storage Read and Write](https://www.nico.fyi/blog/ssr-friendly-local-storage-react-custom-hook): Reading `localStorage` with `useSyncExternalStore` is great and helps avoid hydration mismatches. But you have to work around storage events not firing for the current document.
- ğŸ“œ [Intro to CSS animations for React developers](https://www.developerway.com/posts/intro-to-css-animations-for-react-devs): Interactive article that notably explains the problem with unmounting and animations.
- ğŸ“œ [use() and data fetching](https://flaviocopes.com/use-and-data-fetching/): Moves data fetching from `useEffect` to an RSC, which also shows Reactâ€™s ability to serialize promises.
- ğŸ“œ [Reliable date formatting in Next.js](https://next-intl-docs.vercel.app/blog/date-formatting-nextjs): To avoid hydration mismatches, you need to use the same Date/timestamp, timezone, and locale across both client/server environments. `next-intl` gives you APIs to help you do so.
- ğŸ“œ [Inverse Assertions](https://www.epicweb.dev/inverse-assertions): An interesting React Testing Library technique to assert a side effect did NT happen.
- ğŸ“œ [Types of React Components](https://www.robinwieruch.de/react-component-types/): Documenting component types from 2013 to 2024\.
- ğŸ“œ [Proxy state management: MobX vs Valtio](https://www.frontendundefined.com/posts/monthly/proxy-state-management-mobx-valtio/)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Query 5.59 \- Experimental support for `use()`](https://github.com/TanStack/query/releases/tag/v5.59.0): When using the new `experimental_prefetchInRender` option, the library will return a stable promise that you can `use()` making it easier to integrate with React 19 Suspense in a performant way. Itâ€™s more convenient than `usePrefetchQuery` and more parallel than `useSuspenseQuery` which can create waterfalls.
- ğŸ“¦ [Live Compositor \- React renderer for mixing real-time livestreams](https://compositor.live/): A new innovative product from Software Mansion provides live video and audio mixing capabilities similar to OBS through a familiar React interface. Open-source but requires a license for production usage.
- ğŸ“¦ [React Aria \- September 30, 2024 Release \- Color Pickers stable, Button pending state, Tree beta, Disclosure, DisclosureGroup (accordion)](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/releases/2024-09-30.html)
- ğŸ“¦ [Vaul 1.0 \- Drawer component for React \- Rewritten, improved, new docs](https://github.com/emilkowalski/vaul/releases/tag/v1.0.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Framer-Motion 11.9 \- `useAnimate()` mini, much smaller, built on top of WAAPI](https://www.framer.com/motion/use-animate/#usage)
- ğŸ“¦ [React-admin \- October 2024 Update](https://marmelab.com/blog/2024/09/27/react-admin-october-2024-update.html)
- ğŸ¥ [Remotion on Shark Tank \- Pitching a programming framework on TV](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XzY1ukohYdA): Remotion is the first React framework to pitch Shark Tank investors, and they even got an offer\!
- ğŸ¥ [Delba \- React explained: 'use client'](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eO51VVCpTk0): Greatly explained, and another great usage of Remotion\!
- ğŸ¥ [Theo \- Next.js has real competition now (TanStack Start)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nz43Vuy9_dE)
- ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington \- Legend State v3 \- Local first sync and fastest React State manager](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xkWvDG6uEfk)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [This Month in React 2024-09 â€“ Async Components, a React 19 cheatsheet, Static Hermes, and trademarks drama](https://podcasters.spotify.com/pod/show/reactiflux/episodes/TMiR-2024-09--Async-Components----a-React-19-cheatsheet--static-Hermes--and-trademarks-drama-e2p2o6j)

- ğŸ¦ [React-Native-Bottom-Tabs preview](https://x.com/o_kwasniewski/status/1841383968148509149): Oskar is working on a new native tabs component using SwiftUI TabView and Android BottomNavigationView. Compatible with react-native-screens, it should be an almost drop-in replacement to the JS-based one from React-Navigation. The demo highlights the difference between native/JS, particularly for the VisionOS platform.
- ğŸ¦ [Tzvetan Mikov \- â€œThe Problem of Intl in Hermesâ€](https://x.com/tmikov/status/1840575141182636469)
- ğŸ“œ [Meta has rebuilt Instagram and Facebook for its Quest headsets](https://techcrunch.com/2024/09/25/meta-has-rebuilt-instagram-and-facebook-for-its-quest-headsets/): The announcement is not technical, but this VR experience is built with React Native and running on Static Hermes. **Edit**: this [more technical blog post](https://engineering.fb.com/2024/10/02/android/react-at-meta-connect-2024/) came out just before hitting publish!

- ğŸ“¦ [Code-Push-Server](https://github.com/microsoft/code-push-server): Microsoft open-sourced a server implementation of CodePush before shutting down App Center to avoid disrupting apps relying on it. Note that the [React Native SDK doesnâ€™t plan to support the New Architecture](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-code-push/issues/2696) although someone found a way to make it work with the Interop layer.
- ğŸ“¦ [Expo-File-System@next](https://docs.expo.dev/versions/unversioned/sdk/filesystem-next/): The upcoming SDK 52 version has been rewritten to be simpler and fully synchronous.
- ğŸ“¦ [Expo-Speech-Recognition](https://github.com/jamsch/expo-speech-recognition): Cross-platform speech recognition for iOS, Android and Web.

- ğŸ“¦ [Lottie v1.0 specification](https://www.linuxfoundation.org/press/lottie-animation-community-announces-lottie-v1.0-specification)
